website_summaries.verdict: A quality set of six quickdraws from one of our favorite climbing brands. Their attention to detail makes these our favorite pick.
pros: Extra durable thanks to the H-shaped cross design
Can comfortably support 500 pounds for extended periods of time
Easy to feed rope or webbing through
cons: On the heavier side compared to other trad quickdraws

customer_reviews.title: Really Solid Draws
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with the Petzl draws over BD or any other brands because the biners seemed to be more fluid. The BD biners had a stickiness or heaviness to them that made it frustrating to clip the rope into (especially when you're a desperate climber like me...). These were also cheaper than the higher end BD draws, so overall just a solid option that you won't be bummed about adding to your rack.
customer_reviews.author: Dayne

customer_reviews.title: Seriously it’s Petzl of course it’s a great product. Not the lightest but still awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy. Seriously though you should always train with extra weight if you don’t already. I use it with my quick clip stick works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Deyo

customer_reviews.title: These feel like the quality you would expect from Petzl
customer_reviews.text: These feel like the quality you would expect from Petzl, and despite being light weight, I would expect them to last a long time. Necessary and functional tool for climbing. I bought a second pack after being impressed with the first.
customer_reviews.author: Melle12

customer_reviews.title: SAVED MY SKIN
customer_reviews.text: Had a harrowing experience on a cliff-face, and these quick-draws held me after a 30-ft fall. I'd take them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah O’Hern

customer_reviews.title: Light, solid, dependable.
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Not much to say about it though. They’re quickdraws. Not too heavy, nice crisp gates, great for sport climbing.
customer_reviews.author: JBazz

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid quick draws
customer_reviews.text: I like the solid quick draws (as opposed to wire) because they can’t get caught up in your fingers while clipping. The color coding is so handy and I feel really safe with these draws. Great value buy!
customer_reviews.author: Evyn Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great draws for sport climbing.
customer_reviews.text: Great sport draws. Slightly heavy for trad climbing, but it's barely noticeable. It's really easy to handle, clip and unclip. I have a set of Wild Country Helium 2 and I still prefer Djinn for sport climbing.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great draws
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my GF as she had been wanting some good draws for a while and doesn't like open gate biners. Already used a few times and they work like they are supposed to. Nice lightweight draws. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Petzl makes some of the best climbing gear, and these draws are amazing
customer_reviews.author: Lane Carter

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about these
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these. They are light, do not have the notch where the gate closes, have great spring action and are affordable. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: wsmith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great draws for sport. Super easy to control and clip.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic customer service, and one hell of a quick draw, super stout. Very high quality for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Michael. G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic draws
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, stiff sling, awesome gate action, easy clipping. I feel very comfortable climbing above these. Will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, best deal in quickdraws
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid quality not the lightest, but for the money you can't beat them I like the shape of the 'biner, it makes grabbing to clip super smooth I wish the lower carabiner had a machined flat on the gate like the Express Best deal in quickdraws
customer_reviews.author: crossroadsX

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the weight, quality and the ease of usability
customer_reviews.author: Sal Demir

customer_reviews.title: A gift for my son. I will NEVER have ...
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my son. I will NEVER have a use for these things. The boy loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gallion

customer_reviews.title: The pic is not what you get
customer_reviews.text: I've got only 5 pieces and the picture shows 6.
customer_reviews.author: Jimena

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic customer service, and one hell of a quick draw, super stout. Very high quality for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quickdraws that don't break.
customer_reviews.text: Snappy, clippy, and they don't seem to break! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these not specifically for climbing, but more so to replace what I use with my hammock so that I can use them as a dual purpose when I am out hiking/camping and climbing as well. The gate action is very smooth and haven't had any issues feeding rope or webbing through. Very light and a great product in my opinion. Haven't had to take any falls on them yet, but they have held 500+ lbs statically for about 2 hours with no visible warping of the metal (obviously it would be hard to reach a critical weight on these regardless of what you are doing.).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dascalos

customer_reviews.title: but they are very sturdy. They are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These get the job done. They may not be the lightest, but they are very sturdy. They are easy to use. Easy to put on bolts and take off. We use them to lengthen our hammock, hold gear together or attach a kid while hiking. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal on a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent deal on an excellent product -- high-quality, durable quickdraws that are lightweight and look good, too! Great to pack for a trip overseas, or to include in your normal sport-climbing pack -- or both, as I've done.
customer_reviews.author: K.Wilkinson

product_meta.title: PETZL Djinn Axess Quickdraw - 6 Pack
product_meta.description: The DJINN AXESS quickdraw is a reliable, durable solution for initiation to outdoor climbing. It has an AXESS sling and two DJINN carabiners: one straight-gate carabiner on top and one bent-gate carabiner on the bottom. The top carabiner, equipped with the Keylock system and a special nose shape, facilitates clipping and unclipping the anchor. The bottom carabiner is equipped with STRING sling protection to hold the carabiner in position and to facilitate clipping the rope.
feature_bullets: INCLUDES: The DJINN AXESS quickdraw includes a combination of DJINN carabiners. The H-shaped cross section offers improved strength to weight ratio and the wide contact surfaces mean better glide and less wear.
SIZE AND STRENGTH: These lightweight carabiners have gate openings of 24 mm (Straight gate) and 27 mm (Bent gate). Their major axis strength is 23 kN.
DURABLE WEBBING: The AXESS sling is made from durable polyester webbing.
STAYS IN PLACE: The STRING S holds the rope end carabiner in place and helps protect the webbing from abrasion.
DETAILS: The 12 cm quickdraw uses a Straight gate DJINN carabiner for the top and a Bent gate Djinn carabiner for the bottom.
